author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester City will cope just fine after Gabriel Jesus' injury, insists Pep Guardiola
text:
Sport Manchester City will cope just fine after Gabriel Jesus' injury, insists Pep Guardiola "We did very good things with Gabriel, but also without him" says boss PLUS: Ex-Barca coach rules out ever rejoining them Share The teen scored three goals in as many starts, but his season may have ended in his fourth (Photo: Getty Images) Share     
Pep Guardiola insists the loss of Gabriel Jesus will not slow Manchester City ’s revival. 
Guardiola fears the teen sensation Jesus may not play again this season because of a broken metatarsal. 
Long-time first-choice Sergio Aguero replaced the Brazilian when he came off at Bournemouth on Monday night. 
And boss Guardiola is confident the Blues will cope without their new talisman, who has already scored three goals since his arrival last month. The Brazilian forward has had surgery in Spain to repair the broken metatarsal 
He said: “We played Tottenham without Gabriel and we played really good against one of the best teams in the Premier League. We did very good things with Gabriel, but also without him. 
“We have seven strikers. We are going to use another one and, of course, Sergio will be so important for us.” 
Jesus was operated on by Guardiola’s favourite surgeon Dr Ramon Cugat in Barcelona – and Guardiola says he does not know when the £27million striker will return. Jesus' injury is expected to see benched hero Aguero restored to the starting XI (Photo: PA) 
The Spaniard said: “What’s important now is a good recovery. When he will be fit, I don’t know if it will be now or next season.” 
The 19-year-old's injury means Aguero — benched for the last three games — is expected to start at Championship promotion-chasers Huddersfield in the FA Cup on Saturday, as City bid to extend their four-game winning run.
